intro: Xanthostemon ramosus, commonly known as the bush lily, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and has a shrub-like appearance with lance-shaped leaves. Xanthostemon ramosus is known for its fragrant blooms and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for various pollinators.
